issue.title: Redundant move-assignment operator of tuple should be removed

discussion.p: N2770 (and thus now the WP) removed the non-template move-assignment operator from tuple's class definition, but the latter individual member description does still provide this operator. Is this (a) an oversight and can it (b) be solved as part of an editorial process?

blockquote.p: We believe that the proposed resolution's part 1 is editorial.

Regarding part 2, we either remove the specification as proposed, or else add back the declaration to which the specification refers. Alisdair and Bill prefer the latter. It is not immediately obvious whether the function is intended to be present.
We recommend that the Project Editor restore the missing declaration and that we keep part 2 of the issue alive.

discussion.blockquote: Leave this open pending the removal of concepts from the WD.
